events.title: Founding of Rome
events.description: According to Roman tradition, Romulus founded the city of Rome on April 21, 753 BC, marking the start of Roman civilization.
events.significance: This event marks the legendary origins of one of the greatest civilizations in history.

events.title: Coronation of Henry VIII
events.description: Henry VIII was crowned King of England after succeeding his father, Henry VII.
events.significance: Henry VIII's reign led to significant religious and political changes, including the English Reformation.

events.title: Battle of San Jacinto
events.description: During the Texas Revolution, Texan forces led by General Sam Houston defeated the Mexican army, securing Texas independence.
events.significance: This decisive battle led to the establishment of the Republic of Texas.

events.title: The first Father's Day celebrated
events.description: The first observance of Father's Day was celebrated in Spokane, Washington, to honor fathers and paternal bonds.
events.significance: This event started a tradition that spread to many countries and continues annually.

events.title: Brasília officially inaugurated as capital of Brazil
events.description: The new planned city of Brasília was inaugurated, becoming the capital of Brazil and symbolizing modernization.
events.significance: This marked a shift in Brazil’s political and geographic center and was a milestone in urban planning.
